function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Vulnerable populations such as the elderly and individuals with comorbidities are at risk of severe impacts from COVID-19 due to physical inactivity during quarantine and social isolation.","Impact":"Increased vulnerability to severe illness and complications from COVID-19, as well as negative impacts on mental health and well-being.","Mitigation":"Encouraging alternative methods of physical activity and providing support for at-home exercise programs.","Technologies":"Remote fitness technology, virtual exercise classes, and telemedicine for mental health support.","People":"Elderly individuals, individuals with comorbidities, and those experiencing social isolation.","Owner":"Healthcare providers, public health authorities, and community support organizations."},{"Description":"Decreased physical activity levels and increased sedentary time during quarantine and social isolation.","Impact":"Negative effects on physical health, including decreased cardiovascular fitness, muscle strength, and mental well-being.","Mitigation":"Promoting and facilitating at-home exercise programs, providing educational resources on indoor physical activities.","Technologies":"Virtual exercise platforms, home workout equipment, and online fitness tutorials.","People":"Individuals of all ages experiencing quarantine and social isolation.","Owner":"Public health authorities, fitness professionals, and educational institutions."},{"Description":"Lack of research on the relationship between quarantine/social isolation and deliberate physical activities within the home environment.","Impact":"Limited understanding of the potential impacts of quarantine/social isolation on in-home physical activity and mental well-being.","Mitigation":"Conducting research studies on in-home physical activity during quarantine, promoting awareness and education on the importance of physical activity during isolation periods.","Technologies":"Remote monitoring devices, online surveys, and telehealth platforms for data collection and analysis.","People":"Researchers, healthcare professionals, and individuals experiencing quarantine and social isolation.","Owner":"Academic institutions, research organizations, and public health agencies."}]}
